vialab.SMT

Class ViewportZone

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PImage
      • processing.core.PGraphics
        • processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
          • processing.opengl.PGraphics3D

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, processing.core.PConstants

    public class ViewportZone
extends Zone
    A zone that acts like a viewport.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  ViewportZone.Container
      A little subclass used for containing all the zones added to the viewport zone

      Sets the zone used to contain all children.

      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Change the name of this zone.
      void touch()
      The viewport zone does nothing on touch - because all the touches are assigned to the container zone.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewportZone

        public ViewportZone()
        Create a new viewport zone with the default initial position and size

      • ViewportZone

        public ViewportZone(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Create a new viewport zone with the specified initial position and size
        Parameters:
        x - the desired x position of the viewport zone, relative to it's parent zone
        y - the desired y position of the viewport zone, relative to it's parent zone
        width - the desired width of the viewport zone
        height - the desired height of the viewport zone

      • ViewportZone

        public ViewportZone(java.lang.String name,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Create a new viewport zone with the specified initial position and size
        Parameters:
        name - the desired name of the zone
        x - the desired x position of the viewport zone, relative to it's parent zone
        y - the desired y position of the viewport zone, relative to it's parent zone
        width - the desired width of the viewport zone
        height - the desired height of the viewport zone

    • Method Detail

      • assign

        public void assign(Touch... touches)
        Assign touches to this zone. In the case of the viewport zone, touches are actually redirected to the internal container zone.
        Overrides:
        assign in class Zone
        Parameters:
        touches - the list of touches to add to this zone.

      • add

        public boolean add(Zone zone)
        Add the specified zone as a child of this zone.
        Overrides:
        add in class Zone
        Parameters:
        zone -
        Returns:
        true, if the specified zone was already a child of this zone, false otherwise

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Zone zone)
        Add the specified zone as a child of this zone.
        Overrides:
        remove in class Zone
        Parameters:
        zone -
        Returns:
        true, if the specified zone was already a child of this zone, false otherwise

        Description copied from class: Zone
        Change the name of this zone.
        Overrides:
        setName in class Zone

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws a dark translucent rectangle
        Overrides:
        draw in class Zone

      • touch

        public void touch()
        The viewport zone does nothing on touch - because all the touches are assigned to the container zone. This method should never be invoked, but could be, theoretically.
        Overrides:
        touch in class Zone

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Refreshes this viewport's graphics object.

      • resetView

        public void resetView()
        Refreshes this viewport's view matrix.

      • setContainerName

        public void setContainerName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the zone used to contain all children so that it's touchMyZone( Zone) method can be written in the PApplet.
        Parameters:
        name - the desired name of the container

      • setContainer

        public void setContainer(ViewportZone.Container container)
        Sets the zone used to contain all children. Use this if you want to use a custom class that extends ViewportZone.Container for this viewport's container. This function will not migrate any current children from the old container to this new contain. It is recommended that if a migration is required or desireable, it be done manually.
        Parameters:
        container - the desired container

      • getContainer

        public ViewportZone.Container getContainer()
        Gets the zone currently being used to contain all children. Use this if you want to access the container directly, or if you want to be able to switch containers in a viewport zone, then be able to switch them back. One does not need to use this function to add zones to the viewport. ViewportZone.add( Zone) actually adds the zones to the viewport's container.
        Returns:
        the zone currently being used to contain all children.
